intro: Lactuca spicata var. integrifolia, commonly known as the common chicory, is a perennial plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and bluish-green, lance-shaped leaves that are often slightly hairy. The plant produces yellow flowers in composite inflorescences, which are typical of the daisy family. It is native to Europe and parts of Asia but has been naturalized in various regions around the world. This species is often cultivated for its leaves, which can be used in salads or cooked as a vegetable.
